comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: The ship in the centre looks like it might be Hobart or Perth.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: The ship on the right looks like one of the Grimsby class sloops,  Yarra, Parramatta or Swan

comment.author: 8108294@N05
comment._content: Yes, appears to be late 30s or even 40s (though I know nothing about the ships). Construction of the Cahill Expressway c. 1961 greatly altered the road layout in front of the Conservatorium. The Government House entrance lodge is now on the opposite side of the entrance drive, which was rerouted, the sandstone gateway having apparently been shifted as well. At a guess, the photo could well have been taken from the roof of The Astor apartments.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/tony_rodd] @ Tony Rodd - I see from your flickr profile that you are a botanist with huge knowledge of the "Sydney" Botanic Gardens. There are a lot of old historic photos of the Gardens in this State Records NSW photostream, which would benefit from your expertise, I think. Unusual plant species, odd buildings and dates etc. For example www.flickr.com/search/?w=27331537@N06&q=botanic . Please go wild with notes and comments!
